member.summary: Passes registration of any subschemas back to .

member.remarks: Just call on each schema contained within the keyword.

member.summary: Indicates the keyword as it appears in a schema.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.SchemaKeywordRegistry
member.summary: Manages which keywords are known by the system.
member.remarks: Because the deserialization process relies on keywords being registered, this class cannot be an instance class like the other registries in this library. Therefore keywords are registered for all schemas.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.SchemaKeywordRegistry.GetImplementationType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the implementation for a given keyword name.
member.returns: The keyword type, if registered; otherwise null.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.SchemaKeywordRegistry.RegisterNullValue``1(``0)
member.summary: Registers a null-value for a keyword.
member.remarks: This is important for keywords that accept null, like `default` and `const`. Without this step, the serializer will skip keywords that have nulls.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.SchemaPriorityAttribute
member.remarks: Keywords are processed in priority order. This will help process multiple keywords in the proper sequence.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.SchemaRegistry.Register(System.Uri,Json.Schema.JsonSchema)
member.param: The URI ID of the schema..

member.name: M:Json.Schema.SchemaRegistry.RegisterAnchor(System.Uri,System.String,Json.Schema.JsonSchema)
member.summary: Registers a schema by a named anchor.
member.param: The URI ID of the schema.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.SchemaRegistry.Get(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a schema by URI ID and/or anchor.
member.returns: The schema, if registered in either this or the global registry;4 otherwise null.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.ValidationContext
member.summary: Provides a single source of data for validation operations.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.ContextConsolidator
member.summary: Consolidates properties from multiple child contexts onto a single parent context. Generally, a keyword will define how it handles its own consolidation. This action must be registered on startup.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates whether the validation passed or failed.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.Ignore
member.summary: Indicates whether this context should be ignored in the validation output. (e.g. `$defs`)

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.Annotations
member.summary: The collection of annotations collected during the validation pass.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.NestedContexts
member.summary: The collection of validation contexts from nested schemas.
member.remarks: This property is lazy and will create a value upon first access. To check whether there are any nested contexts, use .

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.SiblingContexts
member.summary: The collection of validation contexts of sibling keywords that have already been processed.
member.remarks: This property is lazy and will create a value upon first access. To check whether there are any nested contexts, use .

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.Options
member.summary: The option set for the validation.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.SchemaLocation
member.summary: The current subschema location relative to the schema root.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.InstanceLocation
member.summary: The current instance location relative to the instance root.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.CurrentUri
member.summary: The current URI, based on `$id` and `$anchor` keywords present in the schema.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.ApplyOptimizations
member.summary: Whether processing optimizations can be applied (output format = flag).

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.HasNestedContexts
member.summary: Whether the context has any nested contexts.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.HasSiblingContexts
member.summary: Whether the context has any sibling contexts.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.From(Json.Schema.ValidationContext,System.Nullable{Json.Pointer.JsonPointer}@,System.Nullable{System.Text.Json.JsonElement}@,System.Nullable{Json.Pointer.JsonPointer}@,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new context from an existing one. Use this for subschema validations.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.ConsolidateAnnotations
member.summary: Invokes all consolidation actions. Should be called at the end of processing an applicator keyword.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationContext.SetAnnotation(System.String,System.Object)
member.param: The annotation key. Typically the name of the keyword.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.ValidationOptions
member.summary: Allows configuration of the validation process.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationOptions.ValidateAs
member.summary: Indicates which schema draft to process as. This will filter the keywords of a schema based on their support.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationOptions.ValidateMetaSchema
member.summary: Indicates whether the schema should be validated against its `$schema` value. this is not typically necessary.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationOptions.SchemaRegistry
member.summary: The local schema registry. If a schema is not found here, it will automatically check the global registry as well.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationOptions.VocabularyRegistry
member.summary: The local vocabulary registry. If a schema is not found here, it will automatically check the global registry as well.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates whether the validation passed or failed.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.Annotations
member.summary: The collection of annotations from this node.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.SchemaLocation
member.summary: The schema location that generated this node.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.InstanceLocation
member.summary: The instance location that was processed.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.AbsoluteSchemaLocation
member.summary: The absolute schema location. Only available if the schema had an absolute URI ID.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.ToDetailed
member.summary: Transforms the results to the `details` format.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.ToBasic
member.summary: Transforms the results to the `basic` format.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.ValidationResults.ToFlag
member.summary: Transforms the results to the `flag` format.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Vocabularies
member.summary: Declares the vocabularies of the supported drafts.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.Vocabulary
member.summary: Represents a Draft 2019-09 and later vocabulary.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.Vocabulary.Keywords
member.summary: The types of the keywords that are defined by the vocabulary.

member.param: The types of the keywords that are defined by the vocabulary.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.Vocabulary.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type})
member.param: The types of the keywords that are defined by the vocabulary.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.VocabularyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the ID of the vocabulary a keyword belongs to.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.VocabularyKeyword.Validate(Json.Schema.ValidationContext)
member.param: Contextual details for the validation process.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry.Register(Json.Schema.Vocabulary)
member.summary: Registers a vocabulary. This does not register the vocabulary's keywords. This must be done separately.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.VocabularyRegistry.IsKnown(System.Uri)
member.summary: Indicates whether a vocabulary is known by URI ID and/or anchor.
member.returns: true, if registered in either this or the global registry; false otherwise.
